reviewText: Fairly run-of-the-mill in terms of adult content, nothing you wouldn't see on Rule 34 or something similar. The puzzle game itself is surprisingly addicting, though, and the characters are pretty enjoyable. My favorite character overall is probably Aiko, but Kyu is far and away the funniest of the bunch. If someone made a mod where she was voiced by John DeLancey (get it, Q, Kyu?), I think I'd die laughing.\n\nThe game revels in how politically incorrect it is. Every woman you meet is pretty much one or another stereotype (i.e. the good girl, the mega-♥♥♥♥♥, the catgirl, etc.), as Kyu herself is often quick to point out. Most of the women play their parts to such a straight degree that it's hard not to laugh, but Kyu's no fourth wall" conversations turn the whole thing into pure gold ("Come on
date: seduce me with your sexy puzzle skills!").\n\nIt isn't really possible to "lose" at HuniePop

reviewText:
Bought the game in response to excessive laughter due to reviews of the game, posts relating to the game, and general reactions to the game.

The match three game was pretty good. Date gifts added a pretty interesting level of depth, considering how basic match-3s usually are. I found myself staring at the board for surprisingly long durations trying to optimize my next move. It was a pretty mechanically sound puzzle minigame.
There's also the faster variant, which I'm not actually sure if you can fail or not, but I managed to avoid letting the bar completely empty after the first few seconds.
Bejeweled Blitz will prepare you for Match-3: Prepare to Fast mode.

As ridiculous as the dialogue was, this is the one occasion where I could actually bet that the game wasn't completely exaggerating. It didn't feel like any of the characters were really the same, and it (at least to me) justified the sometimes cringe-worthy or side-busting things they'd wind up saying, since it seemed to closely match their personality.
At the very least, the dialogue was incredibly amusing in its own right.

This game also reminded me I will never have a blue haired gf that has that much of an interest in vidya.

All in all, ♥♥♥♥ these birds.
10/10, buy this game.

With that said, its a desent match 3 RPG dating sim, and I sincerly hope to see more games like it.

reviewText:
Finally, game developers are beginning to realize that there are girls who enjoy banging other girls.

HuniePop is a puzzle game and a dating sim, but is also a softcore H-game. It really makes me happy to see stuff like this on the Steam Store, since obviously no prudish retailer would ever stock it.

The puzzle games are fun, and the dating portions are fun. It all blends together really well. The writing is cheesy sometimes, but also perfectly believable. There's even voices for every girl, though I'm really glad there's an option to turn them off... no offense to the voice actors or anything. The best part is that everyone refers you to your gender of choice. I finally don't have to feel excluded and can be completely immersed when I want to see some dating sim anime boobies (if only they were all like that).

The girls are all interesting, and very unique, almost guaranteeing you will find a girl who is right for you. However, if you settle for just one, you aren't getting very far. The goal is to bang all the girls. Yes, all of them. What else were you expecting from an H-game? The pictures you receive are a satisfying reward for all the work you put into getting to know the girls and taking them out on puzzle dates.

I definitely recommend this game to all you pervs out there, but I also highly advise you grab the uncensor patch before playing it, because otherwise you're really missing out on the blue hair on Nikki's naughty bits.

reviewText:
This game makes losers like myself feel like we matter.

HuniePop is puzzle game wrapped within a sexy dating sim. There's full nudity (if you grab the uncensored mod, courtesy of the devs themselves and extremely easy to install), multiple levels of difficutly and challenge, and a type of woman for everyone. This game goes extremely in-depth with it's character developmet, something I personally look for when I dive into a story. The artstyle is very nice to look at, the music is relaxing to listen to, and you might learn a thing or two about dating. So let's see: Puzzle/challenge... check. Full nudity and sex... check. Buy this game and support the awesome developers. Seriously, how many game developers can you name that are ballsy enough to put full nudity AND sex into their game? Let alone focus the entire game around just that?
voteText: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
'Mature' is a subjective term.

HuniePop is gracefully unapologetic in it's presentation and it's character. Having originally peeked at a copy which I didn't own for laughs, I was treated to an actually really hilarious set-up for what turned out to be one of the most fun and hilarious games I've ever played.

HuniePop is an example of really knowing it's audience. Anyone willing to spend time with an open mind gets to experience this gem of a game on Steam. The gameplay is your standard match 3, it's straightforward enough for someone who's totally useless at puzzle games to get into and learn how to kind of pass everything but you can ramp the difficulty up if you want that.

HuniePop's selling point is the humour. It's seriously funny if you have that kind of sense of humour. It's dumb, it knows it's stupid but it doesn't care. Just watch the intro sequence, if you laugh. It's probably for you.

Pros:
Character designs are broad and fun. Beli best girl.
Gameplay is straightforward enough for anyone to get into but has a ramping difficulty curve if you need that.
Not all of the game is thrown at you. You have to figure out how to get into bits of it.
The item system is initially somewhat confusing but you can easily figure out what setups are good for you if you put some thought into it.
It's seriously funny.
It still has some subtlety to it despite this. There are a few things about characters that poke fun at public perception in a very clever way.
It won't break the bank for price.

Cons:
Don't expect depth from the characters. They've very caricature and stereotypical.
It's very dumb. Though this is a minor point.
Very minor: There's a tiny amount of tinkering to unlock the blocked away parts of the game though it's simple enough and there's a walkthrough in the forum area.
Once you've smashed everything, there's not that much replayability.

In short, it's really good for what it does and it's a welcome addition to Steam in my opinion. It's funny, has it's own charm and have had some serious laughter over it.

I don't think I'll ever figure out why half the people on my friends list who own this game are girls though.

reviewText:
The way you go around town and talk to the girls is pretty fluid. The way the game kinda takes you by the hand and teases you about the next girl, encouraging you to meet them all, feels natural. The fact that you can't save on your own is a bother, but as a result the game is a lot on the forgiving side. You never really lose anything, so all you have to do is go for it. Besides, even if you can see the girls' profiles on the internet or even in the game (second tab of their HunieBee entries), sometimes they'all ask you completely random questions you have to give some sort of a personal answer. And that's nice.

And And I'm a sucker for match-three, bejeweled, shariki, you name it. The extra strategy you need was like a hurricane of fresh air because it isn't ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t like most game modes in Candy Crush. Gearing up with gifts is part of the strategy too, so it ends up being somewhat complex and actually challenging.

I'm kinda sad there is no closure though. I've reached a point I can win any date just having a couple passion matches and then flirtating (green blocks) forever. The difficulty curve is neatly planned until you get the last date with two girls, more or less. It gets far too easy then even if the difficulty keeps raising.

That and I would have loved some character development, especially for best girl Audrey. I suppose that's just how dating sims are, but it's kinda disappointing.

reviewText:
Not-So-Speedy review go:
Are you tired of your games having no eye-candy? Or perhaps you hate how your dating sims have no professional voice actress, is made in Flash, and has no redeeming qualities? Well, this may or may not be the game that was made for me  you!

Huniepop - a fast dating sim, with a touch of fantasy, made to make your evenings cosy and your time spent fast.

What fun gimmick is expected of this almost typical dating sim? A minigame. One single minigame. Luckily, the minigame (that we all have played somewhere before) has some interesting mechanics that makes you want to think two, maybe three, turns ahead. Though this sort of immersion into the minigame might make one forget what game he's actually playing, a puzzle game perhaps..?

Now as for the actual Sim part, it's nothing too advanced if you have played any other typical game of the same genre - ya gotta talk, gift and flirt to win over the ladies. Oh wait, I'm wrong. By doing the mentioned stuff, you only score points for the date minigames and your own skill upgrades. Which means, ya can't get the ladies by using up all the dosh. Interesting in it's own way.

To summarise, the game is worth it's price. Is it to fun to play? I'd say yes. Does it have an interesting cast? 9 (+3) outta 9. Will you be banned for posting your earned trophies" on steam community? Yes."

reviewText:
An excellent game that combines various genres (puzzle, RPG, dating sim) very well. Very addicting.

The first thing you should be aware of is that, between CGs explicitly depicting the female anatomy and the pursuit and outcome of having sex, the game's content is elevated from softcore titillation that Steam has typically released up to this point (i.e. Sakura Spirit) to hardcore hentai. Fair warning that that's what you're getting into; at its core, you're playing for sexy porn pictures, and you're buying a hentai game. It's good porn if you're factoring that in.

The game is VERY fun though. It incorporates a simple match 3 game that you've seen countless times, and adds enough rules and stipulations to distinguish it from other games. At later points in the game, you'll have to play carefully to make the right plays, deliver the right gifts at the right times to reach the end of a date successfully with limited moves available to you. There's enough strategy to engage you meaningfully. And, let's face it, exploding coloured tiles has always been supremely satisfying. And then the game changes when you successfully bring a woman to your room, and the game changes in such a simple and yet genius way, removing the time limit and turning the game into a race to pop matches as quickly as possible.

The main progression comes from learning more about the girls, increasing your skills, and expanding your options for game-changing items in dates. It feels meaningful and coincides well with the gradual increase in difficulty as the game goes. Gameplay is the best part about the game, really.

Surrounding the gameplay, it's just a very professionally done package. Full voice acting is solid for the most part, the OST makes for delightful BGM when doing puzzles, art in general is very crisp and clear, the character sprites have solid variety in how their expressions change and in changes of clothing; lip sync is an incredibly nice touch.

The writing in the game is smart, witty, and plays primarily to the expectations of a western audience and to the mentalities of a player" picking up women. It's exceptionally tongue-in-cheek; the dating sim is
recommended: a genre of manipulation and telling the girls what they want to hear
hoursPlayed: and HuniePop replicates that without falling prey to traditional Japanese writing tropes. There isn't much of a narrative and the characters aren't exactly deep
voteText: but the writing is spot on for interactions between any number of them.\n\nIt's an exceptionally well-done game. You won't be disappointed."

reviewText:
Hey, do you want to play a Dating Sims game in which...

- You aren't yourself just to satisfy whomever you're trying to get with?
- Do drugs and other illegal substances to bond with the given girl?
- Ask them about their cup size as if it's totally normal to bring up.
- Hear girls cuss everything out to the point it'd even make a sailor blush?
- Only exchange 2-3 lines of dialogue is required in order to date the girl?
- Some will think you're gross for enjoying company while you're out.
- Wear skimpy outfits during a hiking trip up the mountain?
- Get girls drunk in hopes they'll come to your house for 'reasons'?
- Girls refuse to socialize with you until they're fed... after every single conversation.
- A magical fairy tries to help you get laid for some reason.
- Girls sending you selfies, trying to act cute / sexy despite only seeing you for one day.
- Puzzles that will get so hard, that if you're careless, you will screw your entire playthrough up?
Well look no further! HuniePop is a fun, simple Dating Sims game that smacks reality & common sense right out of your freaken face. Want to be a nice dude who's actually in it for the .. you know, dates? NOPE. Enjoy joking about people's race and openly talking to strangers about how sexy they are and wanting to smoke a joint. The game has nice visuals though, and hilarious dialogue. Personally the puzzle is weak, the conversations are to short, I felt used because in order to bond- I needed to buy the girls SO much loot rather then actually getting along naturally. Another problem is that nothing happens when you actually go out on a date. They just change clothes and you beat the puzzle, that's it.

Do note this game is good, especially for a $10 game. If you want something to spice up a Dating Sims game with fun, likable characters then this game does work well. I even admired that the girls will ask you in trivia to what you've learned about them. A huge flaw though is the core of the game's focus .... to get your guy actually dating. Since you finally get to socialize and hook up with someone, shouldn't that be more developed? Instead we get a guy who tries sleeping with 7-8 girls while trying to get them as drunk as heavily possible.

This doesn't make the game bad. It is fun, and enjoyable... and addicting even. But it's not exactly that brilliant of a Visual Novel and not even that 'erotic' compared to other Visual Novels. If you want an amazing Visual Novel with both depth, detail, and great story telling- just look into Katawa Shoujo. It's free to download. For something very erotic, best just to do porn man. Why bother with a Visual Novel for that?

reviewText: I feel a little weird putting a review on this, but I have to, and I have to give it a big thumbs up.  All in all it totally blew me away at how much attention to detail and polish was put in this game.  All characters are fully voiced, the dialogue and scripts are well done (the personalities between the girls really come out), and the graphics are colorful and fantastic.  Even when I thought I had maybe beaten the game, it added even more surprises (and more characters).  The puzzle mode is also fun but not too complicated.  It's also a very real puzzle mode, they're not just handing you a free win.  Even on easy (and I'm still not sure what the difference in the difficulty levels are) I found myself having to carefully plan my moves and my power-up items.\n\nOh, and there's boobs.  I know that's what you came for, and admittedly, so did I, but there's surprisingly a well-polished and fantastic game behind it.

reviewText:
Huniepop is a misunderstood game. Underneath all that sexual contents lie a relatively fun puzzle game. Think of it as Bejeweled, with sex. Basically all you need to do in this game is to match tokens. The more tokens you match, the better, as it will net you more score and, and sometimes a power up token, which if broken can net even more score. Some girls prefer different type of tokens, which will net you more score if matched, though they may dislike certain tokens, which if matched, won't make you lose your score, but you will get very little points for doing so. There are also penalty tokens, which will reduce your score if matched, and some power up tokens, which provide some bonuses to the tokens matched, or allows power ups to be used.

Other than the puzzle aspect, there is the dating aspect, where you need to buy stuffs for whoever you are dating. Some girls like certain types of items, which will help you in terms on improving your traits. Some items, if given to certain girls, will net you a present in return. This present will contain an item which will help you in your dates (aka some power up used for the puzzle sections mentioned earlier). Some power ups are useful depending on your style of playing. Once you have dated all the girls, you may unlock another mode, where the difficulty keep on increasing. Basically the date never ends (three cheers for endless polygamy and dating behind the girls back).

There are many types of girls you can date. You can choose the girl net door, the Asian, the MILF, the cougar, the mega betch and so on. They have different personalities, but this does not really affect the gameplay aspects of this game. It's mostly on your preferences on who to date, though note that under certain circumstances you may unlock additional girls to date. Once you reached certain amount of..... love meter, you will get to sleep with them if your date at night is successful. This will consist of another puzzle game, albeit without the penalty tokens mentioned in the usual puzzle games. Keep breaking them and you will hear the girl moan a lot, once you filled up the meter, you will get to hear the girl reach her climax, and a CG image of the girl naked (or semi-naked). Yay.

Overall, if you like puzzle games and massive fan services, you may enjoy this game. Just don't play this game in front of your parents or children. They may think you are some kind of a weirdo. I know I am one.

reviewText:
A Paladin’s Review: Huniepop. The Review that will Doom My Credibility Forever.Genre: Tactical Match-3 Puzzle Anime Dating Sim
Developed & Published by: Huniepot
Platform Support: Windows, Mac and Linux
Business Model: Base Game
Copy gifted by a friendRead the full and unabridged review on A Paladin Without A Crusade.[kingisaaclinksr.com]

Preamble
I started the series A Paladin’s Journey Through Steam earlier this year which was a series that features interesting new releases on Steam. One of the earliest and notable titles I ran across was Huniepop. A game that I wrote off quickly and cynically. To me, all I saw was another lazily made anime game designed for lonely nerds who just wanted boobies to look at. I even got some pretty amusing comments about it. (Though I’m quite bemused that a friend called this review. Curses.). However, I was linked to Jesse Cox’s look at the game in that thread and gave it a look. I figured that all I would lose is some time and maybe a few laughs at its expense. What I saw instead, surprised me. Not only did I notice that the game was not simply a cheap or poorly developed game, but a game with voice acting, narrative and in-depth mechanics. That took me aback and I knew then that I had to review it. Even if that meant I would eat some crow today.

Overall Gameplay Thoughts
Huniepop is a part dating sim and part match-three puzzle game. The dating sim part is where you’ll converse and interact with one of the eight women in the game. Each containing their own distinctive personality, preferences and voice actor. The match-three puzzle section is a board of affection blocks that you must match effectively in 20 turns. For the most part, Huniepop is focused on game mechanics than the story, expecting players to build their own narrative as the game goes on. Though granted the most narrative you’ll build is just how great/terrible you are with the ladies. There aren’t any men to date so if you’re into guys, well, this isn’t the game for you. It’s been awhile since I’ve done a review of a match-three game and it’s bemusing to me that it’s another genre-mixer that gets me interested in talking about it again. The combination of dating sim and match-three puzzles is weird and it does require you to accept that this is just how the game works. Even if it’s rather silly if you think about it. That said, the mixing works and gives the game a natural rhythm and pace that I quite enjoyed.

Match-3 Mechanics
How it essentially works is that you have to get to a certain level of affection with 20 turns/plays. You accomplish this by matching color blocks together and using date gifts at the right times. At first, the game is fairly forgiving of mistakes but as time goes on, you have to optimize each turn to gain the most amount of affection. The match-3 board has a few different twists from traditional games. First off, you’re able to move blocks around as far as you want in horizontal or vertical directions, giving you a little bit more flexibility in matching tiles together. Secondly, the game has date gifts (up to six available at any one time) which change how the board acts, give you additional turns, allow for scoring combos and much more. The date gifts give you several different ways to play in the puzzle sessions and it’ll be up to you to figure out winning combos. There’s a nice amount of variety with some combinations being risky while others safer though potentially can be screwed by the RNG. It creates a very tactical match-three experience that I really didn't expect. Each move can potentially be the difference between winning and losing.

PC Settings and Audio/Visual
Huniepop has a decent but still lacking settings menu. There’s fullscreen and windowed mode but with no resolution options. There’s a particle slider for when you complete matches in the puzzle game and that’s it for visual settings. Huniepop does have good audio control settings though. You can change the background music, sound effects and voice-over volume sliders. You can even use boops instead of the voice acting for when characters talk to you. Which is nice because lines are often repeated ad-nauseam and people can find this annoying rather quickly.

This is an anime game so of course it’s got the expected anime style. Which is very well done I should say. The women and background are well designed and consistent. Their faces can also display a variety of emotions and their lip flaps move well with the voice acting. The CGI-photo cards are just as impressive. The soundtrack is a laid-back, almost elevator style of various styles that will get old sooner rather than later. Probably about the same time as you’ll get tired of the repeated lines.

Final Thoughts
While I had initially wrote off Huniepop as a lazy anime dating sim, I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was something more than that. Yes, it’s an anime dating game. Yes, it has all that you would expect from this genre (silly plot, sexuality, etc) and I’m clearly the demographic for it. It also doesn’t have any way of failing outside of achievement hunting. However, the mechanical depth that Huniepop is impressive. To the point that it has keeps what could have been a lazy boobs+match3 game and turns it into a title that’s genuinely enjoyable and amusing. It’s a dating game that isn’t just about being nice to every single woman you meet until they show up in your bedroom. You’ll have to get to know them and change your approach to win them over. Whether you choose to take it seriously or not, the match three portion is quite good as well, featuring some unique ideas and challenging, tactical gameplay to ensure that complacency will be punished. Overall, a well crafted dating sim and puzzle game worth considering, even if the sexual content doesn't interest you.

Read this review and more on A Paladin Without A Crusade.[kingisaaclinksr.com]

reviewText:
==== Review ====HuniePop is a dating sim intended for older players (an uncensored patch can be applied). Reminiscent of a less restrictive form of the Persona series' Social Link game mechanic, you run around talking to 8 (+4 secret) girls in an attempt to take them home with you. You have 3 phases during each day that will dictate the style of date/location you will meet each girl, along with times when girls are unavailable. An overall success meter for each girl is presented and progressed through dates" which occurs in the form of match 3 games. This switch from playing 20 questions is pretty refreshing and adds an addictive element to the game.

I'm actually a bit surprised of the content Steam has allowed in the standard version. Most "adult" VN's in their censored form is usually neutered to a point beyond recognition of the original developer's intent. HuniePop managed to keep all of the mature dialogue and pictures.

==== Issues ====The only major gripe I had with this game is that my cursor does not seem to properly align to the selections. I'll always have to shift left or right to select
date:
open or close an item. Another minor greivance is that fullscreen options aren't available until after the tutorial is completed. I also definitely would've preferred better aspect ratio options (only two options given - no resolution numbers presented).

==== Score ====Great

reviewText:
HuniePop, a dating simulator where you impress the girl using your match-three, Bejeweled or Candy Crush skills. Match accordingly to the girl's most preferred traits and try to avoid her least preferred traits whenever possible. Make sure not to match the broken hearts!

Sounds: The voice acting is all right.

Music/Soundtrack: The music gets sort of repetitive over time.

Addictiveness: It's pretty addictive if you are into match-three, Bejeweled or Candy Crush type of games and are into weird anime stuff.

User Interface: I'd say the user interface is pretty good for a dating simulator game like this. However, I had to run the game Windowed as opposed to my preferred Full-Screen No Border as for some reason the visuals in both left and right sides get messed up if I happen to force it to run full-screen no border.

Story: It's about you dating more and more girls through the power of match-three and trying your best to not let them know you're cheating on them.

Gameplay: You just play the game as how you would play a match-three game, Bejeweled or Candy Crush, except it's sort of mixed with some Visual Novel gameplay. However, you are given date gifts and traits that are meant to help you out during the match-three gameplay.

Characters: The characters in HuniePop are somewhat an exaggerated version of realistic personalities. You have the cute, pure and short girl everyone likes. There's also the ♥♥♥♥♥y, hot and ♥♥♥♥♥♥-bag girl every guy likes. Then there's you, the perverted weeaboo who decided that you don't have the courage to ask a guy/girl out on a date in real life and decided to play this game.

Enjoyment: ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

At the time of posting this review, it is 26th of June 2015 and I have 10 hours played with a 66% progression on my save game. I will edit accordingly as I read feedback, put more time and progress further into the game.

reviewText:
Look, HuniePop is a satisfying match-3 game hidden inside a dating simulation with some uneven art assets, some likable characters, and hit-or-miss humor. It is nice that you can choose to be male or female, but in both cases, you will be seducing women. The dialogue will change to accommodate your gender. The game also comes censored, but that can be patched out with instructions in the game's Community Hub. I played the uncensored version with mixed results; I will go over the reasons later. If you are easily offended by nudity and vulgarity, you will do well to avoid this game and pick up Puzzle Quest instead for your match-3 fix. Please do not use this game as a guide to women in any capacity. You cannot match-3 your way into someone's heart or pants.

The match-3 gameplay is quite good and has a number of things that keep me coming back for more. You start off with only twenty moves to make the date a success. Every date's outcome is determined by your ability to match three or more tokens with each other, but not all tokens are the same. Each woman has a liked trait and a disliked trait that you will need to take into consideration. A woman that reacts well to Talent tokens and not as well to Seduction tokens creates a different focus on how tackle the puzzle in front of you. There are Talent, Flirtation, Romance, and Seduction.  Then there are four other tokens with very different effects: Joy, which adds a move; Sentiment, what you need to use items; Passion, which acts as a point multiplier; and Heartbreak, which detracts from your total score by a percentage. You will unlock images with successful dates which become more and more racy. When you take a lady that likes you enough on a night date, the two of you then engage in physical shenanigans. You can expect more match-3, but with a lot more moaning and a speed requirement that simulates reaching a climax. If you are bad at this section, expect to hear so much moaning that it turns into a case of semantic satiation, when you say a word over and over again until it loses all meaning temporarily.

After you beat the sexual encounter match-3 segments, you will then be treated to the final and fourth image of that woman you took out. Here is where the mixed results complaint of mine appears with the uncensored version. Some of the representations of female anatomy are not accurate and give this surreal image of a woman's parts that are both there and not there. You will notice, assuming you are familiar with the female body, that some drawings fail to present all the necessary components of a proper ♥♥♥♥♥. It gives this odd feeling of privates that were grafted onto a Barbie doll, both incomplete and flat. I suppose women do not need to pee, ever. As a result, you will probably find the women much more arousing with their panties on which can be toggled.

But that's not all, I almost forgot to mention the items you can use on dates. They function as gifts that you give to the lady you are on a date on that cost Sentiment. You can have up to six items and they can have varying effects that range from consuming all of one token, increasing the frequency of a token's spawn rate, changing Heartbreak tokens into another type, and even granting extra moves which is what my build is centered around. One of my favorite combos is using the Stuffed Penguin, an item converts all Heartbreak tokens in Joy tokens, with Sunflower, an item that gives +1 move for each Joy token after the first two. You will be given random items for use as you give women regular gifts.

The dating experience tends to follow this pattern: talk to woman, learn about her, answer her questions, give her food so that you two can talk more, go on a date. Usually, they will not accept drinks until they like you enough. Drinks increase the Hunie multiplier and that is important because you use Hunie to increase your skills to keep up with the increasing difficulty. Also, your character turns out to be a piece of garbage liar that will do anything for sex if you want to engage with all the content. You can expect to date up to at least twelve ladies; three of them have special unlock conditions. Quite a few of them are materialistic and not likeable due to other things, the gift giving mechanic probably did not do those characters any favors. Beli and a few others have decent personalities. If you were looking for a legal cat-girl with the vocabulary of a child, this game has that for you.

The game also has jokes, sometimes about sex. Do you think ♥♥♥♥♥♥ are funny? Are you into collecting panties of women you have dated? Well... Hey, HuniePop has all that and a box of tissues. I am also constantly surprised at how all of these women have not gone into a diabetic coma with all the food I have been feeding them. I am sure she is doing just fine after those twelve pancakes and four corn dogs in one sitting.

This game hooked me with the match-3. I wouldn't have so many hours otherwise. I would not mind an endless mode where I could match tokens to my heart's content.

reviewText:
So I have decided to completely rewrite this review, since the circumstances have changed pretty dramatically for me!

Huniepop got a not recommended from me last time, mainly because the game did not work what so ever for me. However, that has since been fixed with help from friends, and the game now runs perfectly fine for me.

Plot:
Huniepop is a game based around the classic, Asian idea of a harem. You can play either a girl or boy, but it doesn't really seem to change the dynamics of the game much at all, and the goal is to have romantic relations with as many different women as possible, each with their own preferences, personalities, and weaknesses.

Gameplay:
Gameplay is a bit unique here. Instead of relying solely on linear dialogue options, Huniepop does things a bit different, by using a 'game within the game', which is a sort of sex version of Bejeweled, or Candy Crush. You mix 3 or more of the same color to get Passion, Sexuality, Talent, Extra Turns, and some few others, to raise the progress bar. If you manage to fill the progress bar to full before you run out of turns, you win, and gain a large amount of in-game money to buy presents for them with.

Dialogue:
The Dialogue is honestly not bad at all, and the English is properly written and pronounced. Although the dialogue itself is largely pointless except for when one of the girls asks you if you remember past facts that they've told you, it does help a bit with immersion, and is not the classic curse of dialogues: Pointless time stretching with no actual impact on the game.

Graphics/Art Quality:
Best that I've seen in a long time, although Sakura Spirit is really nicely done in my opinion, Huniepop has a bit of an edge over it because of...Well...The Explicit content! What explicit content!?" is probably the question on your mind right now

reviewText: I don't think anyone really needs a steam review to know whether or not they should buy Hunie Pop, but I'll write it anyways. If you're expecting any sort of actual story or character depth beyond basic personality elements, you should look somewhere else, because Hunie Pop has a lot more in common with Newgrounds dating sim flash games than quality dating VNs like Hatoful Boyfriend. Each of the girls has a set of 12 traits like their age, bra size, hobby, etc that you can ask them about, and they have a few shared questions that they'll ask you, and that's about the extent of your interaction (Nikki is still the best girl, though). You meet and greet them, and then you meat them, which is done through a match-3 game that's a lot more complicated and challenging than it has any right to be in this game. There are four basic types of gems representing different romantic attributes, and each girl has one type that they prefer (which gives a bonus for matching them) and one that they like less than the rest. There are also gems that increase your score multiplayer, gems that make you lose points if they get matched, gems that give you extra moves (you're limited in how many moves you can make before you fail the date), and gems that give you points that you can spend to use items obtained from giving the girls gifts, which do a wide variety of things. You can also increase the amount of dating points given from each type of gem by spending experience points gained from dates and talking to the girls. The difficulty ramps up surprisingly quickly, and it's actually surprisingly fun overall.\n\nThe dialogue is sometimes laughably awful, primarily from the main character's choices and Audrey (who is the worst girl, objectively) but the game seems to be self-aware of that and comes off as a so-bad-it's-kind-of-good thing, but you'll probably end up skipping through the voice acting or turning it off altogether by the time you're halfway in because of how little actual variety there is in the dialogue. The game is also censored, like most of the sexual VNs on Steam, but the developer has provided an uncensor patch that you can find pretty easily on the forums or guides if you want to see a few pictures of boobs. Overall I would recommend waiting for a sale, but it's not as bad as I thought it would be.

reviewText:
Gee, what to say about this... Alright, let's see.

HuniePop is a Dating Sim game with Puzzle and RPG elements. You play as... Well, yourself (Male or Female) and go after several girls to date and ultimately get in the bed with to achieve total success. If you're playing as a female, the only thing that changes is the girl's seuxal orientation.

The game first starts by meeting a normal girl called Kyu, after awkwardly attempting to talk to her, she later appears in your room at night, now having fairy wings, and pink hair. Kyu says that she's a love fairy, and her job is to get people who can't date to... Be able to date. She does this by having you play a Bejewled/Candy Crush type game where you match 3 or more icons in a row. It'll win the girl's affection if you do well enough. After explaining, Kyu lets you roam the town, out looking for girls to date.

Now, I normally don't like date sims as they're bland and boring, but this one is actually pretty in depth and has very likeable characters. All of the girls are very distinct and unique in their own way, and there's bound to be one you'll find as a favorite. There's even a few hidden girls with more unique traits. (Kyu herself as well.) It's not just dating either, there's management of your Munie" and "Hunie"

reviewText:
At first, I was relatively hesitant to play this game; english VA, match-3(I despise candy crush), and whatnot.

However, after watching a certain video by Jesse, tried it out myself.

I was surprised at how good the game actually is. With me not being a big fan of match-3 games, this one actually hooked me in.

The mechanics of how certain orbs/tokens affect the meter. multiplier system, sentiment system and the gifts, were really a good surprise at how well it meshed together to make it into a pretty fun and somewhat challenging game. The RPG/Dating Sim elements are also pretty well done and contributed positively to the overall gaming experience. The unlockable customization options are also a big boon, since I didn't really like some initial character designs, I was able to go around that with the customization for the characters.

The art is well drawn, clean, colorful and vibrant all around. Lots of cute going on around.

The characters are surprisingly well written. At first I thought they were pretty bland and one dimensional; covering all the generic tropes, but as I got on further into the game, found surprising nuances in their characters.

The sound design is what you would expect of a match 3, so I'll end that there. What really got to me were the voice acting and the BGMs. The Voices are pretty well done with some iffy stuff here and there, but overall good and mostly matched what the characters are. The BGMs, I found myself wanting the soundtrack for it.

My few gripes of it would probably be the tutorial and some menu/interface elements. The tutorial left me with a few questions left unanswered like which Token is which attribute. The lack of an save and exit option left me clueless as to how to go about ending my session (which also led me to unlock everything up to the 10th girl in one sitting. Maybe that's what the devs actually wanted to happen, you sly dogs). An indicator to which gift I've already given to the current girl in the shop would have been also nice; I found myself switching back and forth between the profile and shop menus constantly.

All in all, it was a pretty good experience and I would recommend this game to select people, since the theme isn't exactly what would be considered normal.

If I would give it an arbitrary score, it would be an 8/10

reviewText:
I have to admit, I purchased this because I'd seen the Let's Play videos of ths game and because the premise was just so ridiculous that you couldn't help but have your curiousity piqued. There are some reviews/coverage out there that paints this game as being an insult to women, but I didn't entirely see this. I suppose that to a point I could see where some are coming from with that, but any sexism was definitely not intended.

Your enjoyment of this game will ultimately boil down to how much you like games like Bejeweled since that's really the main thrust of the game (no pun intended). The dating sim aspects are somewhat weak and mostly there to string together the various game levels for each girl and give you power ups. The story is probably the weakest part of the game and probably why the charges of sexism are even being levied, since there really isn't a lot to these women other than their datability. While yes, this is an aspect of datings sims to a degree, the good dating sims give you a chance to become at least slightly emotionally invested in the characters. I didn't really get that feeling with this game's characters- not even the person we're supposed to be portraying.

Some of this I can handwave away by this being a first game" that was funded via Kickstarter. The learning process is always a rough one and for this to be the developer's first official game and sorta dating sim (that I'm aware of) it's a pretty darn good one since there are no visible glitches or errors that interrupt gameplay. I'm aware that there wll be a second game and I hope that the developer brings in more character development since that was something that was sorely missing with this game. The dating sim aspect was no risk and while I didn't entirely mind that
date: I did want to see more interaction with the characters and more development. This game had a lot of potential and while it lives up to that on the matching game end
recommended: it was sorely lacking on the dating sim angle. I think that more character development
hoursPlayed: the ability to have some slight risk (like being caught with another girl means that you can't date one or both girls for a set period of time)
voteText: and the ability to choose a Final Girl would have improved this greatly and would be great to have in the sequel.\n\nUltimately I'd recommend this
helpfulPercent: but not to anyone looking for a more involved dating sim or one with any true storyline."

reviewText:
It's two of my favorite things combined; 'Match 3' and Brea~Uhh 'Anime' yes.

Without going into much detail, I think anyone can figure this one out with just some basic comprehension. I'm just going to add that the mechanics in this game are surprisingly refreshing in comparison to a lot of other Match 3 games out there. Though this may partly be because of the dating sim aspect/element that's tied to it, which is nice if you're into that and/or a bit of 'nostalgia' if you played any of those back in the day.

The game is fully voice acted which is really great and if you ask me has better voice acting than a lot of games who share the same price range/budget. Though as is with these sim games; once you get through all the dialogue, the charm may quickly wear off for some, voice acting or not. You can turn it off if you're just playing for the 'puzzles' or whatnot but that would be silly.

If you absolutely can't stand games with an 'anime' appeal, you shouldn't even be reading this let alone consider playing the game. If you're a 'Match 3' fan and not too shy of a potential and probable nosebleed, it's worth a try. If you're a total anime dork with a high level of lewdness, this is probably as close as you can get on Steam.. perhaps even too far if you know where to look, but I'll leave it at that.

reviewText:
Grab your lotion and tissues boys

IntroductionHuniePop is one of those games you discover after feeling a little...frisky...or after browsing the interwebs a little too long at night. Well regardless of how you discover it, it's either you're sold on the girls gameplay or you move on....Oh who am I kidding, it's either you love it, or you love it.

GameplayThis game is essentially two in one; Bejewelled and a Dating Sim. Your goal is to get laid...multiple times. In fact, you're supposed to get laid with ALL the girls and collect their panties. I've gotta say, I've never been more concentrated in my life. You'd think that a game that appeals to our primal nature would be a walk in the park? Heh. This game tests your memory as well as your bejewelled tactics with a tad bit of luck sprinkled in for good measure. I can't even tell you how many times I was 1 move away from getting the girl; sink or swim. Most of the time I'd fail and go lie down and curl up in my bed trying not to cry. However on those epic moments where I made the right moves, I'd excitedly punch a wall knowing what I was to experience. But no, the struggle wouldn't end there. No no, from start to finish, it would be a fast paced match-3/4/5 minigame as you watch with childish excitement as clothes came off calmly watch a woman's chest become exposed and her make some unique sounds.

The game was easy to get into, but was actually challenging in many respects. But let's be real here, who's gonna boast about getting all the achievements in HuniePop amirite? Don't judge me :(

VisualsThe cartoony visuals were just fine for this type of game. The most appealing parts were of course....well you know.

AudioThe music was fairly good, though at times it could get almost repetitive but at least it was good enough to listen to.
The voice actors for each of the ladies did their parts pretty damn well, though some of their moans were a bit weird lol.

SummaryYou're either gonna love this game for the girls or you're not going to be interested. The bejewelled style of gameplay and the dating sim aspect are both not unique but done well enough to keep you interested. This will appeal to some people, but not all, and your reasons for playing this will vary.

If you like these types of games then:

8/10 worth a buy sex sells amirite?

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/

reviewText:
I never expected this game to be so addictive. I bought this game as I heard about it from Kotaku and from the general internet so I decided to buy on a 50% off sale. This game is a hybrid genre being a date sim/puzzle game and is definitely a good mix. The story without telling too much is Kyu, who is a fairy wants to help you get a girlfriend and to do this she get you to talk to women and you are off. The day is split into four parts morning, midday, evening and night where you can visit whichever women you want in each of these four parts of the day.

When dating women you are required to play a bejeweled type of game where you match colours (with consideration to the women’s colour preferences). On the fourth night the women sends you a lewd picture of herself to you and once a 5th date is reached at night then you get to enter the bedroom scene where the explicit content mainly occurs which can be dependent of whether you choose to download the uncensored patch or not https://steamcommunity.com/app/339800/discussions/0/616198900649668367/

Positives
-Addictiveness
-Replayability
-The animation style
-Animation quality and detail
-Sexually arousing
-Great background artwork
-Amazing gameplay
-A decent amount to do (if you are a completionist)
-Official censorship removal patch
-Wonderful background music
-Wonderful replacement for real life women :)
-Not to easy and not to hard (until Alpha mode XD)
-Voice acting (I’m a weeaboo and love Japanese voices for most things with animated visuals however I love Huniepop’s voice actors even in English :)

Negatives
-Not enough characters (even though there is 12 characters and this is a minor complaint)
-Bedroom scene is sometimes a bit too difficult for some people (however there is a mod to fix this difficulty issue)

Conclusion
This game to me was definitely worth the money and I even bought my friend this game as well. I recommend it to all who love anime/animated visuals, people who are weeaboos, males or bi-women and have an appretiation for lewd games, why, because of the plot :)

reviewText:
This is a bit of a weird game. I wouldn't really call it a visual novel..at all. So I think having that in the description is a little misleading. So if that's the kind of thing you're looking for, look elsewhere for sure. The closest to that you'd get are the (wonderfully hilarious) character introductions in the game - which last all about ten minutes or so. Looking past that little issue however lies a somewhat addicting match 3 puzzle game with dating elements and of course, lewd imagery.

The dating sim portion of the game comes into play with getting information out of the girls, learning things about them and using that knowledge to answer their questions correctly to earn Hunnie (what this game calls it's EXP) - which you use to improve 8 stats which effect your play in the puzzle portions of the game. All the characters and lines are fully voiced and performed well, so trying to get all the info isn't too much of a boring chore until you start running into repeat questions. You can give each girl gifts to upgrade their Hunnie/EXP multiplier, as well as get hair styles to customize them with. You earn outfits as well, so if you're into collecting and playing dress - that's for you.

The actual dates and what I'd call the meat of the game are the match 3 puzzles. They invoke a little bit of Puzzle Quest, minus actively fighting an enemy. You're instead trying to reach a total point count with a numbered set of moves - making every match you make count. It's the first time I've played a match 3 in this way and I really enjoy planning moves ahead to make the use of matches. You can also equip items for use mid-date to alter the board or use one time abilities. This way it becomes a little bit more than your average match 3 game and it got a little addicting for me personally - a good thing for a basic puzzler to have.

It's a shame the dating sim portions are light while the VN elements evaporate in the first 7 minutes - having more around this puzzley core would make this game much better. Regardless, the way those puzzles made me think led to me honestly enjoying my time with the game.

..But hey, the art and CG in the game is pretty good. I know you're looking for that too!

It's two of my favorite things combined; 'Match 3' and Brea~Uhh 'Anime' yes.

Without going into much detail, I think anyone can figure this one out with just some basic comprehension. I'm just going to add that the mechanics in this game are surprisingly refreshing in comparison to a lot of other Match 3 games out there. Though this may partly be because of the dating sim aspect/element that's tied to it, which is nice if you're into that and/or a bit of 'nostalgia' if you played any of those back in the day.

The game is fully voice acted which is really great and if you ask me has better voice acting than a lot of games who share the same price range/budget. Though as is with these sim games; once you get through all the dialogue, the charm may quickly wear off for some, voice acting or not. You can turn it off if you're just playing for the 'puzzles' or whatnot but that would be silly.

If you absolutely can't stand games with an 'anime' appeal, you shouldn't even be reading this let alone consider playing the game. If you're a 'Match 3' fan and not too shy of a potential and probable nosebleed, it's worth a try. If you're a total anime dork with a high level of lewdness, this is probably as close as you can get on Steam.. perhaps even too far if you know where to look, but I'll leave it at that.

reviewText:
I had a joke review up previously, but I decided to write a serious one.

Going into this game, I had low expectations. The writing looked awful from the infamous mall scene with Audrey and Kyanna. The gameplay looked pretty boring.

I was legitimately impressed by this game. It takes the classic bejewled style puzzle gameplay and tweaks it just enough that it  feels fresh. The sentiment and passion mechanic makes you plan your moves out ahead. On higher difficulties, you'll fail quite a bit if you're not precise.

There's a waifu for everyone in this game. A small touch, you can play as either a male or female and there's no difference outside of the pronouns used in dialogue and a few changed lines.  It's not  a huge deal, but I really appreciated that there wasn't any pandering to either gender.

The OST is pretty catchy. You'll be humming some of the tracks for days to come.

Oh, and there's a huge amount of time you can sink into the game. Replaying will get you 100 percent completion and new achievements, and there's an infinite time attack mode for masochists.

I highly recommend this game.

reviewText:
I was pleasantly surprised by this game. After reading the other reviews, I wasn’t really sure about the game, but gave it the benefit of the doubt (also helped by the low pricing).
Don’t take this game too seriously, and you will definitely have a great time. The voice acting is great and really brings the game alive, and the puzzle mechanics are deep enough to pose a challenge but never become impossible.

The only problem I have with this game, is that there is no “ending” to the story. I’ve slept with all the girls, including Kyo and Venus, but the game simply continues.

P.S: I uploaded a 'cheat sheet' with all the girl's details (except for Kyu and Venus, since when you get to them, you've probably fully upgraded your talents) to Gamefaqs. Enjoy!

reviewText:
Saw how Cinnamantoastken and Jessie Cox playing it, and I grab it for a few things.
First one is voice acting, it's actually good. I believe in what these girl's saying, and that's always is a good thing.
Second would be writing, it's a smart writing, and also believeable. I mean, these kind of girls can exist (they rare, but exist).
For some one it could be puzzle part. It's a bit challenging (or it could be just me XD).
For me, the flaws of the game is lack of story, it could be a bit more of it, and not just begining (cuz most of the point in this game is just draging girls in bed). And also, someone could put in minuses the thing that the game is in anime style (not for me).
Oh, and also boobs and fan service. LOTS OF IT. Especially if you install uncesored patch ;)
In conclusion:

+ :
- Good voice acting
- Neat writing
- Good puzzle mechanics (and for someone even challenging)

- :
- Lack of story

Optional -/+
- Fan service and boobs
- Anime style

reviewText:
This game is just fantastic. I cannot recommend it enough; it is brilliantly done. The artwork and music are great, and it is really, really fun to play. It has just the right amount of perviness too - which I believe is essential to any great dating simulator. The devs seem outstanding as well. They added free content for Valentines Day, and I believe there is a DLC planned (sign me up!).

Its only February, but I can honestly say this is the best game I have played so far in 2015 (I am sure it won't be game of the year, but I am just saying).

reviewText: I like this game a lot. Really good art, innovative storyline, creative puzzles, characters with great personalities and backstories. This game is just really full of depth and is a must buy for hardcore gamers. The game does a really nice job of immersing the player into the world of HuniePop from the moment you start the game up. In addition to that, it really teaches the player a nice life lesson that is essential in our modern day society. The game really emphasizes the power and significance of communication with your peers, but makes sure to teach the lesson in a fun and memorable way. It even concentrates on the importance of building friendships, and perfectly captures how friendships work in the real world. I believe that this is the best game I've ever played in my life. Thank you HuniePop, for changing my life for the better. Thank you for enlightening me on what my purpose in life is. Thank you so much.

reviewText: I got this game on a whim, and figure it would be a good laugh for Valentine Day. I must admit I thought it would be the standard Visual Novel style dating sim where I would read a story and then choose options that would affect my ending and which girl I ended up with. I was pleasantly to surprise to get this. Basically you visited by a fairy of love who decide to help you get laid. From there it basically you meet girls, date them, and eventually have sex. A few hidden characters to be unlocked, but other than that this game is very straight forward. The dating portion of the game is a bejewel section where you must match 3 icons of kind. Each icons have their on unique affects on the enjoyment meter for your date. In a nut shell this game is Dating Sim meet Bejewel, which isn't a bad thing if you like playing a perverted Bejewel. Which I do.\n\n

reviewText:
I really don't like these kinds of games. They are usually quite stupid, with vapid characters and uninteresting dialogue. And no voice acting to speak of.

But this game. Holy sweet mother♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ did it impress me. I first saw it in JesseCox's FanFriday video on youtube. Check it out.

This game doesn't have pretty faces that say nothing interesting. The women in this game have hilarious, entertaining, and adult dialogue. There isn't too much dialogue (mostly answer and question format) but the stuff that is there is very enjoyable.
And the voice acting is quite amazing. Every line I've heard so far has successfully coveyed what the speaker wanted to say. When these ladies want to sound sexy, they sound sexy.

The gameplay has its own little re-skin on the Bejeweled style play, and for someone who has never played a Bejewel-esque game it is pretty entertaining.

Now to what is most important next to the dialogue and voice acting: The art. The girls look great, the artstyle conveys a kind of perfection in the models that I haven't seem much of at all. Each image you can unlock (so far) is interesting and unique. And, importantly, hot in its own way.

In short, the game does 'adult' sexy very well, which is certainly a major draw for this game. I would certainly look into buying more products from this developer!


P.S. : Yes, the mechanics used in dating here do not convey to real life. That does not diminish the enjoyment found in this game.

reviewText:
This is a deceitful game.

It comes off as one of those stereotypical hentai dating sims, with some puzzle aspects sprinkled in. And, at its core, that's pretty much what it is. But if you take a chance and really play it through to the later levels, the game gets hard. Brutally hard. But in a good way. I was never much of a Bejewled fan, but the puzzles on this game are near brilliant in design. They really make the player think about each and every move they make, from the beginning of the date to the end.

The dialogue in the game isn't terrible either. Sure, it can be cringe-worthy or downright bad in spots - but the voice acting is very well done, for the most part. The women you can date are pretty much paper thin in personality, but I think that was probably  done on purpose. Overall, outside of the puzzle aspects of the game, the dating sim" part of it ain't half bad either.

Overall

reviewText:
I was a little stand-offish at first. I wondered if the puzzle aspect would be too simple and the game would just be eye candy. If you like manga anime girls. Who doesn't really?
The puzzle aspect of it is fun. I'm hooked. It's not just a dating sim, there is some strategy to completing the puzzles in a limited amount of turns.
I'm a huge fan of the old Bubble Bobble series and Puzzle Quests. If you like those kinds of games with definitely some strong sexual themes and language. You will probably enjoy it as well.

Only negative I guess would be, the dialog for the dates is not very big. So they tend to ask the same questions over and over. That can be fixed with a mouse click to skip their dialog though.

There are collectibles and unlockables, secret characters. Just a fun game to kill some time. Try it out.

reviewText:
The puzzle system is great.  You can slide a gem across the entire column or row to make a match, moving each piece you drag it across too.  This allows for thoughtful combos.  You also unlock special moves that do various things to the board that you can use to build a unique strategy.  The puzzles never really feel unfair;  The game never really feels cheap like some other games do (puzzle quest, anyone?)

While date puzzles give you 20 turns to fill the score, the sex puzzles require you to match gems to fill a depleting meter.  This makes the sex puzzles a change of pace from the careful strategy of the date puzzles to a twitchy match-them-quickly type of play.  It's a different type of challenge entirely and it's great.

The RPG element of leveling up your stats for the puzzles adds a growth element that allows you to overcome the increasing difficulty of the puzzles.  You can raise your stats in any order as well.

I liked the dialogue.  Some people hate it, but I thought it was good.

It has a pretty basic story that I won't get into but it is serviceable to what's going on in the game.  Everything seems to make sense and I guess that means that it's good.

Overall, I'd say the game is worth playing if you're into puzzle games and don't hate the idea of dating women in a video game.

reviewText:
Want an erotic dating sim that makes you feel like you earned that booty?

This is the one.

The puzzle mode that you must defeat in order to earn that steamy night with the girls does become very challenging after a while (especially on alpha mode). To top it off, the voice acting is very well done (realistic throes of passion), the art is very polished, and there are some pretty entertaining jokes in here.

My only huge con for this game is some of the jokes get borderline offensive, but since the game goes off the deep end into ridiculousness quite often, I can't take it too seriously.

Enjoy the naked ladies!

reviewText:
This isn't a stupid one-liner novelty review, so hunker down.

First off, it is what it is. Smut. Let's just get that out of the way. Good.

HuniePop is actually really, REALLY fun. The characters in it feel like actualy people, not just waifu-fodder. The first thing that struck me about this game was the quality of the voice acting. The voice acting alone is enough to warm the depths of your heart (among other things).

The way characters are introduced is a smooth, albeit smei-forced process, where each character will tie into a new one, etc.

The actualy gameplay aspect of it? It's Q&A + Bejewelled that leads to snoo-snoo. What's not to like?

Boobs and smut aside, this is a truly fun experience, and I don't regret buying it one little bit.

reviewText: As if actually OWNING this game isn't bad enough, I now post a review of it. Oh, well, I suppose it must be done. Although it is very much a dating sim, that dosen't detract from it being an interesting iteration on the match-three or Bejeweled" system. The move-capped "date grid" system is certainly an interesting mechanic
date: and forces the player to think about their next move
recommended: instead of just making moves as fast as possible. The added motivation of the end result (which you can probably figure out on your own) dosen't hurt either. You can essentially think of HuniePop in one of two ways: an interesting puzzle-RPG with occasional questionable artwork as a reward
hoursPlayed: or a dating sim/visual novel where your access to CGI photos of naked anime girls is blocked by match-three puzzles. In either case
voteText: I would recommend this game to puzzle game and pornography enthusiasts alike. There you go. A straight-face review of HuniePop. Now

reviewText:
The puzzle system is great.  You can slide a gem across the entire column or row to make a match, moving each piece you drag it across too.  This allows for thoughtful combos.  You also unlock special moves that do various things to the board that you can use to build a unique strategy.  The puzzles never really feel unfair;  The game never really feels cheap like some other games do (puzzle quest, anyone?)

While date puzzles give you 20 turns to fill the score, the sex puzzles require you to match gems to fill a depleting meter.  This makes the sex puzzles a change of pace from the careful strategy of the date puzzles to a twitchy match-them-quickly type of play.  It's a different type of challenge entirely and it's great.

The RPG element of leveling up your stats for the puzzles adds a growth element that allows you to overcome the increasing difficulty of the puzzles.  You can raise your stats in any order as well.

I liked the dialogue.  Some people hate it, but I thought it was good.

It has a pretty basic story that I won't get into but it is serviceable to what's going on in the game.  Everything seems to make sense and I guess that means that it's good.

Overall, I'd say the game is worth playing if you're into puzzle games and don't hate the idea of dating women in a video game.

reviewText:
Want an erotic dating sim that makes you feel like you earned that booty?

This is the one.

The puzzle mode that you must defeat in order to earn that steamy night with the girls does become very challenging after a while (especially on alpha mode). To top it off, the voice acting is very well done (realistic throes of passion), the art is very polished, and there are some pretty entertaining jokes in here.

My only huge con for this game is some of the jokes get borderline offensive, but since the game goes off the deep end into ridiculousness quite often, I can't take it too seriously.

Enjoy the naked ladies!

reviewText:
This isn't a stupid one-liner novelty review, so hunker down.

First off, it is what it is. Smut. Let's just get that out of the way. Good.

HuniePop is actually really, REALLY fun. The characters in it feel like actualy people, not just waifu-fodder. The first thing that struck me about this game was the quality of the voice acting. The voice acting alone is enough to warm the depths of your heart (among other things).

The way characters are introduced is a smooth, albeit smei-forced process, where each character will tie into a new one, etc.

The actualy gameplay aspect of it? It's Q&A + Bejewelled that leads to snoo-snoo. What's not to like?

Boobs and smut aside, this is a truly fun experience, and I don't regret buying it one little bit.
